Song.title: The Look
Song.copyright: Lyrics by John Newton Music & alt. lyrics by Bob Kauflin © 2001 Sovereign Grace Praise

Arrangement.description: Arrangement from Songs For The Cross-Centered Life
Arrangement.text:
Intro: [Dm | Bb C | Dm | Bb C |]
Verse 1: I [Dm]saw one hanging on a tree,{,} in [Bb]agony and [C]blood Who [Dm]fixed His loving eyes on me, as [Gm7]near His cross I [Am7]stood And [Gsus]never till my [G]dying breath, will [Bb]I forget that [Am]look It [Dm]seemed to [C]charge me [Bb2]with His death, Though [Am7]not a word He [G]spoke [| Bb C |]
Verse 2: My [Dm]conscience felt and owned the guilt{,} and [Bb]plunged me in des[C]pair I [Dm]saw my sins His blood had spilt, and [Gm7]helped to nail Him [Am7]there But [Gsus]with a second [G]look He said, “I [Bb]freely all for[Am]give This [Dm]blood is [C]for your [Bb2]ransom paid I [Am7]died that you might [G]live” [| Bb C |]
Chorus: For[F]ever [Bb]etched upon my [Gm]mind, is the [Dm]look of [C]Him who [Bb]died The [F/A]Lamb I cruci[Gm]fied [Csus C] And [F]now my [Bb]life will sing the [Gm]praise, of [Dm]pure a[C]toning [Bb]grace That [F/A]looked on me{,} and [Gm7]gladly [Am7]took my [Bb | Am | Bb | Am7 |]place
Verse 3: Thus [Dm]while His death my sin displays, for [Bb]all the world to [C]view Such [Dm]is the mystery of grace, it [Gm7]seals my pardon [Am7]too With [Gsus]pleasing grief and [G]mournful joy, my [Bb]spirit now is [Am]filled That [Dm]I should [C]such a [Bb2]life destroy Yet [Am7]live by Him I [G]killed [| Bb C |]
Arrangement.searchtext: intro verse 1 i saw one hanging on a tree in agony and blood who fixed his loving eyes on me as near his cross i stood and never till my dying breath will i forget that look it seemed to charge me with his death though not a word he spoke verse 2 my conscience felt and owned the guilt and plunged me in despair i saw my sins his blood had spilt and helped to nail him there but with a second look he said i freely all forgive this blood is for your ransom paid i died that you might live chorus forever etched upon my mind is the look of him who died the lamb i crucified and now my life will sing the praise of pure atoning grace that looked on me and gladly took my place verse 3 thus while his death my sin displays for all the world to view such is the mystery of grace it seals my pardon too with pleasing grief and mournful joy my spirit now is filled that i should such a life destroy yet live by him i killed
